document.docAuthor: Malagón-Aldana, Leonardo A., Smith, David R., Vilhelmsen, Lars & Serna, Francisco
document.masterDocTitle: The sawflies and woodwasps (Hymenoptera: ‘ Symphyta’) of Colombia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The sawflies and woodwasps (Hymenoptera: ‘ Symphyta’) of Colombia

subSubSection.paragraph:

22 October 2002

, 2 spec. , (IAvH-E-149455; IAvH-E- 151258 ). Host: Feeding on litter and dead leaves mostly colonized by fungi (
Flores et al. 2000
).

Comments: The female of
P. tropica
is described as having an antenna with 14-16 flagellomeres (Smith 1990), while in Colombia , in females it varies in number from 11 to 15. Differentiation based on the number of antennomeres between females of other species needs to be re-evaluated. For males, beside number of antennomeres, Smith (1990) usually also uses characters such as the shape of parapenis on genitalia capsule, between U and V shape (among
P. tropica
and
P. picea
), however many intermediate shapes are common. In addition, the association between males and females is still difficult for this genus.
